One of the most challenging and rewarding projects I worked on was CDK Pay, a secure, scalable payment gateway platform that integrates multiple payment methods like Credit/Debit Cards, Bank Transfers, Terminals, and Invite-to-Pay systems.

I was involved from the ground up ‚Äî from architecture and API design to integrating FortisPay as the payment provider. The platform needed to work seamlessly across various dealerships and services, handle PCI-compliant transactions, support tokenization, and enable real-time reporting and reconciliation.

  • Tech Stack: ReactJS, Redux Toolkit, FastAPI, Kafka, AWS Cognito, FortisPay SDK
  • Challenges: Managing complex asynchronous flows, ensuring security & reliability, integrating multiple services smoothly
  • Impact: The platform is now being used by multiple clients and scaled across different services, reducing payment processing time and increasing transparency

text: Describe a challenging time at work and how you handled it.

metadata.answer:
Challenging Time

There was a time when a critical production bug affected the checkout experience on a live payment gateway used by hundreds of dealerships. The issue was intermittent, caused only under specific race conditions between tokenization and charge flows.

Initial panic: It wasn't reproducible in staging, which made debugging even harder.

What I Did:

  • Quickly introduced conditional logging & audit trails to monitor backend flows without disrupting users
  • Simulated real-time race conditions using local mocks and controlled delays
  • Worked closely with the QA team and business users to gather patterns from failed transactions
  • Identified a mismatch in handling of async responses between FortisPay's webhook & client-side confirmations

Outcome:

We deployed a fix within 24 hours. I also wrote a retro and built a chaos-test harness for future edge cases. The leadership appreciated not just the fix, but how transparently it was communicated and handled.

text: How did you build this app?

metadata.answer:
üõ†Ô∏è How I Built This App

This app is powered by a combination of AI, vector search, and clean front-end magic ‚ú®

  • ‚öôÔ∏è Backend: I used Python + FastAPI to create APIs that handle vector search and data management.
  • üìö Vector Search: I'm using ChromaDB to store all the text+metadata and perform similarity searches using sentence embeddings.
  • üß† Embeddings: I used a Sentence Transformer model to convert questions and answers into vectors so they can be matched semantically ‚Äî even if the question isn't asked exactly the same way.
  • üíª Frontend: Built using React, which sends the question to the backend and renders the rich HTML answer beautifully (with support for dark and light themes).
  • üí° Fun Additions: Custom context, dynamic rendering, HTML formatting, and conversational tone make it feel more like a real conversation with me!

It's lightweight, personalized, and super fun to build üòÑ

text: What's your approach to learning new technologies?

üìö My Approach to Learning New Tech

I love learning new technologies ‚Äî it keeps me sharp and curious! üîç My approach is hands-on and structured:

  • Start Small: I begin with the official docs and beginner-friendly tutorials to understand the fundamentals.
